description: Rampion (Campanula rapunculus) is truly an amazing species of plant. Not only does it have uniquely-shaped bell-like purple flowers radiating out from the stem, but is also a wonderful edible that has a sweet taste like lettuce. The light green leaves and stems can be eaten raw in salads, and when cooked, it becomes taste similar to asparagus. Rampion is a hardy species that is easy to grow, surviving in both hot and cool climates. It is a great addition to any garden or landscape, and an excellent way to add colour, texture, and flavour. It's no surprise that rampion is one of the most popular salad greens around!
